avdta.dta

Class Assignment

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.dta.Assignment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Assignment>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MSAAssignment

    public class Assignment
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Assignment>
    This is a wrapper class for an assignment. An assignment specifies the Path that each Vehicle is using. Because the number of vehicles may be large, the Assignment class stores data in a file. An Assignment is stored as several files within a folder. See DTAProject.getAssignmentsFolder() for the root directory. To assign vehicles to the paths listed in this Assignment, see readFromFile(avdta.project.DTAProject, java.util.List, avdta.network.PathList). This requires that vehicles to be sorted by departure times then id, which they normally are.

      • readFromFile

        public void readFromFile(DTAProject project,
                         java.util.List<Vehicle> vehicles,
                         PathList pathlist)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the assignment from the file using the specified PathList. This creates mappings of ids to vehicles and ids to paths for faster lookup. Vehicles are assigned to the path specified by the saved id.
        Parameters:
        project - the project
        vehicles - the list of vehicles
        pathlist - the list of paths
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed
